# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

# Approach
1. Split the input string into words
2. Initialize a variable `current_line` to store the current line
3. Iterate over each word in the list of words
4. If adding the current word increases the total character count by more than `text_width`, append the current line and start a new line with the current word
5. Add the current word to the current line, updating its length after each addition
6. After finishing all words, append the last line to ensure it's not left out
7. Return the final wrapped string

# Solution
```julia
function wrap_string(input::AbstractString) where TextWidth::Int
words = split(input)
lines = [""]

for word in words
if lines[end].length + length(word) > TextWidth
push!(lines, word)
else
lines[end] = linejoin([lines[end], word])
lines[end] = " " * (TextWidth - lines[end].length) + lines[end]
end
end

return join(lines)
end
```
